title: Rewriting the Expression by Distributing the Negative Sign
text: First, distribute the negative sign and rewrite the expression as an addition problem. For example, $$a+b-c+d=a+b-c-d$$.
speech: First, distribute the negative sign and rewrite the expression as an addition problem. For example,  a plus b minus c plus d is equal to, a plus b minus c minus d .
pacedSpeech: First, distribute the negative sign and rewrite the expression as an addition problem. For example,   a plus b minus c plus d is equal to, a plus b minus c minus d

title: Adding Complex Numbers
text: The next step to add complex numbers is to add real and imaginary parts separately.
speech: The next step to add complex numbers is to add real and imaginary parts separately.
pacedSpeech: The next step to add complex numbers is to add real and imaginary parts separately.

title: i Definition
text: i represents the square root of $$-1$$, which is an imaginary number.
speech: i represents the square root of  minus 1 , which is an imaginary number.
pacedSpeech: i represents the square root of   minus 1

title: Real Parts in the Expression
speech: minus 5  and  11  are the real parts.

title: Sum of the Real Parts
text: What is the sum of the real parts?
speech: What is the sum of the real parts?
pacedSpeech: What is the sum of the real parts?

title: Sum of the Imaginary Parts
text: What is the sum of the imaginary parts?
speech: What is the sum of the imaginary parts?
pacedSpeech: What is the sum of the imaginary parts?

title: Writing the Final Answer
text: Finally, write the expression as the sum of sums of the real and imaginary numbers.
speech: Finally, write the expression as the sum of sums of the real and imaginary numbers.
pacedSpeech: Finally, write the expression as the sum of sums of the real and imaginary numbers.
